result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Joseph Oiyotte

records.addlTxt:
10:15 AM Cases 21CF255, 2022CF000013, 2022CF000066 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert Joseph Oiyotte in court, in custody.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Robert Joseph Oiyotte.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Taber: def pleading to Ct 1 22CF66: threat to law enforcement officer, Case 22CF13 to be DRI; def agreeing to revocation of DJOC in 21CF255; parties requesting PSI, State capped at PSI recommendation, otherwise free to argue.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 of 22CF66 and orders a JOC; 22CF13 is DRI, DJOC is revoked and judgment is entered.  State assures VR compliance.  Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to be present, but should be available by phone- if needed- for sentencing hearing.  Court revokes bond in all files at this time.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Back on the record 10:34 AM, same appearances.  Atty Taber argues to reconsider revoking bond.  State responds.  Discussion of previous bonds.  Court does not reconsider, bond is revoked.
Writ of Habeas Corpus
Plea hearing on August 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:46 AM Called 21CF255, 22CF12 and 22CF66 for STC and motion hearing.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert Joseph Oiyotte appeared by video, in custody from the Polk Co Jail.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Robert Joseph Oiyotte.  Attny Taber updates the court, matter resolved ready for a plea hearing, $5,000 bond and has sat 51 days. Can post about $1,000.  State makes a comment.  Court reviews past bond, doesn't think past bond was forfeit.  Court denies bond modification request, but will have PLEAH on 8-16, can renew bond modification request at that time.  Def currently at Polk Co jail, he would like to come to Burnett County to have the PLEAH in person. Bond continues. Plea hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Discovery Demand

Order granting withdrawal
Motion- to Withdraw
Atty Davis letter to Judge regarding defendant status

*The defendant must post an additional S2500 cash bond to be released from custody in lieu of treatment.
*If the Defendant provides documentation that he has been accepted to inpatient treatment, the additional cash bond will not be required at this time.  If he is accepted to treatment, he can only be released from custody to a representative or liaison of the tribe or treatment facility to be driven directly to his residence to obtain clothing and personal hygiene items as approved for entry into the treatment program and may not be at his residence for more than one (1) hour and must be supervised at all times. After retrieving his personal items, he will then be driven to the St. Croix Trial Clinic for his medical assisted appointment for entry into the treatment program and immediately thereafter be driven to the airport to fly to the treatment facility If he successfully graduates treatment, he must report to the designated halfway house or group home until successful completion. If he is terminated from either at any time, he must immediately report back to the Burnett County Jail and return to custody. If he successfully completes both, he is to report immediately to court for a review of his bond and conditions after successful completion. 
*No use or possession of alcohol. Defendant is restricted from any establishments whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol- such as bars, taverns. beer tents, and liquor stores. No contact with TT or his residence. No use or possession of illegal drugs. substances, or paraphernalia. Subject to testing of blood, breath, or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion. No contact with JT or RJ. No abusive contact with any law enforcement officer
Order- to amend bond

The defendant must post an additional S2500 cash bond to be released from custody in lieu of treatment. If the Defendant provides documentation that he has been accepted to inpatient treatment, the additional cash bond will not be required at this time. If he is accepted to treatment, he can only be released from custody to a representative or liaison of the tribe or treatment facility to be driven directly to the airport and from there to the treatment facility. If he successfully graduates treatment, he must report to the designated halfway house or group home until successful completion. If he is terminated from either at any time, he must immediately report back to the Burnett County Jail and return to custody. If he successfully completes both, he is to report immediately to court for a review of his bond and conditions after successful completion. 
No use or possession of alcohol. Defendant is restricted from any establishments whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol- such as bars, taverns. beer tents, and liquor stores. No contact with T.T. or his residence. No use or possession of illegal drugs. substances, or paraphernalia. Subject to testing of blood, breath, or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion. No contact with J.T. or R.J.. No abusive contact with any law enforcement officer.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

03:18 PM Called 22CF13 & 22CF66 scheduled for PH, and 21CF255 for STC.  Defendant Robert Joseph Oiyotte in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Defendant in custody from Barron County jail, in custody for Burnett Co.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin in person.  Robert Joseph Oiyotte appeared by video means with Attorney by separate video means. Attny and Def confirm today will be WOPH for two cases. 22CF13 & 22CF66 on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over in both cases.  State efiles information, mirror criminal complaints, confirms vic rights compliance.   Both Cases on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts in both cases.  Discussion of bond modification to allow for treatment, State confirms court remembers concerns correctly.  Get information about program to Court ASAP to get permission to travel to attend program.  Def would remain under bond conditions still and would need to return to jurisdiction after program.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

03:49 PM Cases 21CF255, 22CF13, and 22CF66 called together.  Defendant, Robert Joseph Oiyotte, appeared with Attorney Nicholas Von Davis, who is newly privately retained and will file a notice of retainer.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody. Case 22CF66 on for initial appearance.  Court provides criminal complaints to 22CF13 and 22CF66.  Case 22CF66 proceeds to initial appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def has filed a pro-se bond motion.  WTLPH.  Atty Davis argues in support of defendant's motion to modify bond, requests signature bond with conditions for programming with absolute sobriety and random testing.  DA Rennicke argues against bond modification.  Court questions def re: programming- def to attend in Washington through tribe.  Atty Davis supplements argument.  Court makes record.  Court wants documented proof of the inpatient programming and that the person coordinating treatment will provide transport, court will revisit bond and amend the bond at that time to allow def to go to programming.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Motion hearing on April 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

01:59 PM Called 22CF66 for INIT and 22CF13 and 21CF255 for STC.  Defendant Robert Joseph Oiyotte in court by video, in custody from the Burnett County Jail.  ADA Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion for entry of Judgment filed.  Case 22CF66 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def appears without Attny.  Def plans to retain an Attny privately, Attny Davis, but hasn't talked with him yet.  Def wishes to speak with Attny and schedule an adjourned INIT.  Off the record at 2:02.  Back on the record at 2:02, same appearances as previously noted.  Court reviews court appointed attny option too.  Def filed a letter for bail reduction, court has read bond motion letter.  Def asks for bail reduction to post an additional $1,000 cash.  State did not see bond motion, has nothing to add. Need to give the State 5 days to have notice.  Will schedule bond motion with adjourned INIT for April 6th at 3:30pm.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
